question.title: What is the term for a small, localized infection of the oil glands in the eyelid?
question.description: A small, localized infection of the oil glands in the eyelid, also known as a stye or hordeolum.

option_a.title: Chalazion
option_a.description: A small, painless bump on the eyelid caused by a blocked oil gland

option_b.title: Hordeolum
option_b.description: A small, painful boil on the eyelid or eyelash line

option_c.title: Stye
option_c.description: A small, painful infection of the oil glands in the eyelid

option_d.title: Cyst
option_d.description: A closed sac filled with fluid, typically filled with semi-solid material

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct answer
